insights: AI DOGE data covers 49% of GOV.UK reported expenditure — significant unmapped spend (51% not categorised)
9 categories show significant variance (>25%), including: Housing services (GFRA only), Central services, Other services
Dominant pattern is underspend (5 categories) — AI DOGE spending data captures a subset of total council expenditure reported to MHCLG
"Housing services (GFRA only)" shows 266898% overspend — AI DOGE department mappings may be broader than the GOV.UK SeRCOP classification
"Central services" shows 277% overspend — AI DOGE department mappings may be broader than the GOV.UK SeRCOP classification
As a county council, key service areas include education, social care, and highways — variances in these categories are most significant
